snippet: Alan G. Hevesi, who has been incarcerated since April 2011, will be released by Dec. 19, the State Parole Board said.
abstract: Alan G Hevesi, former New York State comptroller who has been in prison since a 2011 conviction on corruption charges, is granted parole and will be released by Dec 19; Hevesi was sentenced to one to four years for his role in a sprawling scandal involving the state's $153 billion pension fund, which he oversaw as sole trustee.
lead_paragraph: Alan G. Hevesi, who has been incarcerated since April 2011, will be released by Dec. 19, the State Parole Board said.

headline.seo: Alan Hevesi, Ex-State Comptroller, Is Granted Parole
headline.main: Hevesi, Jailed for Corruption, Is Given Parole
headline.print_headline: Hevesi, Jailed for Corruption, Is Given Parole; Ex-Aide Isn’t
